main_name: Tulipa humilis Violacea Group black centre

synonyms: Tulipa humilis var. pulchella 'Violacea' black base
Tulipa humilis Violacea Group black centre

botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts may cause severe discomfort following ingestion, may cause an allergic skin reaction. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Tulipa are bulbous perennials with characteristic flowers, in a wide range of colours, in spring
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Miscellaneous tulips include all species and hybrids not otherwise classified

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant 10-20cm deep in fertile soil in full sun, protect from excessive wet and shelter from strong winds; see tulip cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by lifting and separating offsets; see bulb propagation
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to damage by slugs, aphids and stem and bulb eelworm, squirrels may eat the bulbs
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to tulip fire, tulip viruses and bulb rots
